title: AGGREGATION_POLICIES view | Snowflake Documentation
paragraphs: This Account Usage view provides the aggregation policies in your account.
Each row in this view corresponds to a different aggregation policy.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the aggregation policy.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the schema in which the policy resides.
Schema that contains the aggregation policy.
Internal/system-generated identifier for the database in which the policy resides.
Database to which the aggregation policy belongs.
Name of the role that owns the aggregation policy.
Type signature of the aggregation policy’s arguments.
Comments entered for the aggregation policy (if any).
Date and time when the aggregation policy was created.
Date and time when the aggregation policy was last altered.
Date and time when the aggregation policy was dropped.

The type of role that owns the object, for example ROLE. . If a Snowflake Native App owns the object, the value is APPLICATION. . Snowflake returns NULL if you delete the object because a deleted object does not have an owner role.
Latency for the view may be up to 120 minutes (2 hours).
The view only displays objects for which the current role for the session has been granted access privileges.
